title: Natural Bridges National Monument: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do        Visitors enjoy a guided walk at Natural Bridges NPS Photo by Neal Herbert   Â    Auto Touring The scenic drive is open year-round. This paved, nine-mile loop provides access to all the bridges. Each may be viewed by walking a short distance to an overlook. An archeological site may also be viewed from an overlook along the scenic drive. Camping The 13-site campground is open year-round: first-come, first-served. Hiking While many park features are visible from overlooks along the scenic drive, the true beauty of Natural Bridges lies just a short walk away from the pavement. Moderate hiking trails lead from overlooks to the base of each natural bridge, while longer loops hikes connect the bridges at the canyon bottom or on the mesa top. Ranger Programs Natural Bridges rangers offer a variety of ranger-led activities spring through fall. Evening programs are presented in the campground amphitheater May through October (topics vary). Guided walks, overlook talks (along the loop drive) and patio talks (at the visitor center) are given throughout the week spring through fall. Times and topics vary. Please contact the park or check bulletin boards for current schedules. Stargazing Astronomy programs are presented in the front commons area at Natural Bridges Visitor Center on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday nights through October (weather permitting). All programs start at dusk. Contact the park for more information.
